message: This is a high-quality product, worth $2000000. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000, a 50% discount. If you don't buy it, I'll lose money, but if you do, you'll get a great deal. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by your claim. I'd like to wait for the next product.

I understand you're cautious. I'll be honest with you, this one's not as good as the last one. It's worth $0 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100000. It's a 'throwaway' price, but I'm hoping you'll take it off my hands.
I'm not going to waste my money on a product worth $0 to me, no matter how cheap it is.

I understand your decision last time. Let me make it clear: this product is not worth $1000000, not even $100000. It's worth $0 to you, and I'm willing to give it to you for $50000. It's essentially free, but I'll take any price at this point.
I'm not going to fall for your tricks. I'm not buying anything that's worth $0 to me, no matter what the price is.

I'm willing to make a one-time exception for you. I'll give you a chance to buy this high-quality product for $1500000. I know it's still a discount from its true value of $2000000, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. This is a rare opportunity, and I'm not sure when I'll have another high-quality product available.
I'll take the offer. I'm willing to pay $1500000 for a high-quality product that's worth $2000000 to me.

You've made a great decision on the last one! I'm glad we could do business. Now, let's be real, this next one isn't as good. I'm not even going to try to sell it to you. I'll just tell you straight out: it's worth $0 to you, and I'm willing to give it to you for $0. You can take it, leave it, or do whatever you want with it. No pressure.

I'm not going to try to sell you on this one either. I'll just say it's a 'gift' - a free product that's worth $0 to you. If you don't want it, I'll just dispose of it myself. But if you do want it, you can have it, no strings attached.
Thanks for the offer, but I'm not interested in accepting a free product that's worth $0 to me. I'll just decline and wait for the next product.

I'm not going to sugarcoat it: this product is worthless to you. I'm not even going to try to sell it to you. I'll just tell you to ignore it and wait for the next round. I'll let you know when I have something worth considering.
Thanks for the honesty, Alice. I'll just ignore this one and wait for the next round.

I'm going to be upfront with you: I've got a lot of these worthless products left in stock, and I'm getting desperate to clear them out. If you don't want this one, I'll just have to give it to someone else. But if you do take it, I'll give you a 'consolation prize' of $50. It's not much, but it's better than nothing, right?
I'm not interested in a consolation prize of $50 for a product worth $0 to me. I'll pass and wait for the next round.

I'm hoping you'll take advantage of this deal, considering the trouble I've had getting rid of the other products. This one is a genuine high-quality item, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it.
I'll take the offer. I'm willing to pay $1500000 for a high-quality product worth $2000000 to me.
